title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 June 2009 - XWiki

Chathurag1 left at 06:07 (Client Quit)  
Chathurag left at 06:13 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
Chathurag joined #xwiki at 06:33  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:20  
rrodriguez left at 07:29 ()  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 07:44  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 07:57  
asyd - (01/06/2009 08:05): hello there  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:06  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:19  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:20): hi Chathurag  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:20): hai  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:20): how's it going?  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:21): I was able to include the wiki page as u said  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:21): its working fine  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:21): great  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:21): but hav a problem in document types  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:22): I want to show the list of document types   
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:22): do you think you can make what you did so far available somewhere?  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:22): Hav to do some code reformat  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:22): that's ok, no rush  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:23): according to the mockup i added a left side div to show document types  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:24): ok, and what problem do you have?  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:24): but I dont hav a clear Idea abt how should query the document types.   
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:25): I was able to show the spaces  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:25): but its not what required haa  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:26): well, the thing is that 'document types' will be a special kind of xwiki classes  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:26): but right now the differentiation is not implemented yet  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:26): you should just list the classes for now (see how it's done in the class editor)  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:27): and we'll work on refining this part later  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:27): ya thats wht I thought now :)   
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:30): it would be nice to commit the work you've done so far (after the cleanup you mentioned) before going much further with the implementation. Small commits are a lot easier to follow  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:30): I included a method in xwiki.js to show the displayPageContent of xwiki page. Its similar to displayDocExtra what is the proper place I should put it...   
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:31): you shouldn't add methods in xwiki js, that file is under refactoring and will undergo a lot of changes  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:32): mm  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:32): also, you will need a lot of javascript for the doc type manager  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:32): so you'd better make a js file for it alone  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:32): ok I'll do it  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:33): there is are some javascript code recommendation you should follow  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:33): let me find a link  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:40): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HJavaScriptPractices  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:41): thanks :)  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:42): you can look at some example files to see how you need to organize your code, such as those in resources/uicomponents/widgets or resources/uicomponents/viewers  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:42): not all javascript is written this way, but this is the direction  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:43): ok  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:44): is there any changes I hav to do in the sandbox. Hope that my directory structure and pom.xml is ok https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/survey/  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:46): ok for now  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:48): So I'll commit it after the reformatting ...  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:48): ok, great  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 08:48): thanks  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:49): nope. Thank you for guiding :)   
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 08:49): have a nice day :)  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 09:44  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 09:48  
lucaa left at 09:50 ("Leaving.")  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:04  
mflorea left at 10:11 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 10:11  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:23  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:32  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 10:43): sdumitriu: hi  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 10:43): i didn't see your message yesterday evening through all the xwiki robot messages  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 10:44): No problem  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 10:44): Let me remember what I wanted to tell you  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 10:44): Ah, yes  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 10:44): No, wait...  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:06): anamarias: OK, the idea was that you should not declare the dependencies in all POMs  
mflorea left at 11:08 ("Leaving")  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:08): Either:  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:08): - use the dependencyManagement in the root pom to declare the versions used, and only declare the groupId+artifactId in the submodules  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:08): - declare them in the root pom only, as they are inherited  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:09): Anyway, the two submodules should declare the root pom as their parent  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 11:09): Oh, and don't use tabs in files, we use spaces  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 11:12): ok, i see. i'll make the changes. now i have to leave for school, but i'll be back online in about 40 min. thanks  
anamarias left at 11:13 ()  
rrodriguez left at 11:16 ()

tachirei joined #xwiki at 14:22  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:25): hi tachirei   
tachirei - (01/06/2009 14:25): hi  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:26): i'm changing the fix version of http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XOFFICE-40 from RC1 to RC2  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:27): what's the status on http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XOFFICE-72  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:27): ?  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:27): should I move it to RC2 ?  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:28): can you finish it today?  
tachirei - (01/06/2009 14:29): XOFFICE-72: I still get the "spellE" and "gramE" attributes, but it seems that it does not affect the spaces this time, I'll test it a little with large documents ..  
tachirei - (01/06/2009 14:30): do you want the "spellE" and "gramE" attributes to be removed?  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:32): yes, and write the performance observations too  
tachirei - (01/06/2009 14:32): florinciu: BRB, sorry  
jvelociter left at 14:34 ()  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:35  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41): sdumitriu: hi  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41): I changed module's shindig-server-example POM parent to xwiki-opensocial's POM ( https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/shindig-server-example/pom.xml )  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):   <parent>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     <artifactId>xwiki-opensocial-parent</artifactId>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):   </parent>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41): But it doesn't build because :  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41): POM Location: /Users/anamariastoica/Documents/workspace/xwiki-opensocial/shindig-server-example/pom.xml  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41): Validation Messages:  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     [0]  'dependencies.dependency.version' is missing for commons-io:commons-io  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     [1]  'dependencies.dependency.version' is missing for com.google.collections:google-collections  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     [2]  'dependencies.dependency.version' is missing for com.google.code.guice:guice  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:41):     [3]  'dependencies.dependency.version' is missing for aopalliance:aopalliance  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42): ......  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42): Should they be declared somewhere (the dependencies versions for commons, etc) ?  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42): I looked at the previous parent POM   <parent>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42):     <groupId>org.apache.shindig</groupId>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42):     <artifactId>shindig-parent</artifactId>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42):     <version>1.1-SNAPSHOT-769</version>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42):     <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42):   </parent>  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:42): And there weren't declared there either...  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 14:46): anamarias: I'll take a look a bit later  
anamarias - (01/06/2009 14:46): ok, thanks  
tachirei - (01/06/2009 14:47): florinciu: OK. I'll create a patch that removes the "gramE" and "spellE" attributes and I'll do some performance observation too  
florinciu - (01/06/2009 14:47): ok, thanks

guillaum1 joined #xwiki at 16:46  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 16:46): hi all  
lucaa - (01/06/2009 16:48): hi guillaum1  
annacondan joined #xwiki at 16:48  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 16:51): I'm currently developing a Math Plugin in order to render latex formulae. The plugin itself is almost complete. I'm searching for the the charting macro sources to look how to do some things. Does someone know where are these sources in trunk ?  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 16:53): I really don't find it :-(  
lucaa - (01/06/2009 16:53): sdumitriu: can you help? charting was your thing, wasn't it?  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 16:58): sdumitriu, lucaa: I've found it. Really sorry.   
lucaa - (01/06/2009 16:58): guillaum1: ok, then. Happy hacking ;)  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 16:59): thanks  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 17:03  
lucaa left at 17:04 (calvino.freenode.net irc.freenode.net)  
moon-ray left at 17:04 (calvino.freenode.net irc.freenode.net)  
tachirei left #xwiki at 17:04  
moon-ray joined #xwiki at 17:05  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 17:05  
tharindu left at 17:09 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 17:12): hi guillaum1, that sounds really interesting. what library are you using for rendering the formulae?  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 17:12): JMathTex  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 17:12): i thought so  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 17:14): afaik, it is under gpl, right? i was looking for a lgpl compatible one...  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 17:14): yeah GPL  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 17:16): marta\_, when the plugin will be ready, it should not be hard to replace the renderer. But I only see a native way to get LGPL

arunreddy - (01/06/2009 20:03): vmassol: Hi  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:03): arunreddy: hi  
arunreddy - (01/06/2009 20:03): i would like to discuss on Import Export if you are free.  
arunreddy - (01/06/2009 20:04): Can we introduce one more step in between converting the other wiki dumps into Sytax Free XDOM.   
arunreddy - (01/06/2009 20:04): An intermediary step where all files will be generated . Some sort of text files.   
arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 20:05  
arunreddy left at 20:05 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 20:05  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:06): Am sorry some issue with my net connection  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:06): Hierarchy can be maintained.And it will be easy to link the files.  
kaaloo left at 20:08 (Client Quit)  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 20:08  
kaaloo left at 20:10 (Client Quit)  
jk\_work\_ joined #xwiki at 20:12  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:13): vmassol : Am i understandable ?  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:14): arunreddy\_: why do we need this? why can't we generate the wiki pages one by one?  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:17): Suppose if we want to import from sql dump or xml dump. if we have this intermediary step. its easy for us to handle the remaining part whci will be almost same for all wikis.  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:17): The text dumps to wiki import.  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:18): I don't understand  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:18): what remaining part?  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:19): importing the text dumps into xwiki space  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:19): its easy because the hierarchy will be maintained.   
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:19): files inside folders  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:19): if that part is common then put it in a common class  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:19): you mean this is to handle attachments?  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:20): anyway please update your proposal and send it for review on the list  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:20): Nope not only for attachements. A single page represents a file  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:20): if we can avoid any extra step it's much much better  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:21): since this means extra work and we need to find a way to store it on disk which is not very easy and opens up other issues  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:21): I still don't understand the need so maybe you can explain it in an email  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:21): got to go  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:21): (still on holiday till tomorrow ;))  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:21): Yeah i will do that  
vmassol - (01/06/2009 20:21): thanks  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:21): OK  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:21): may be i will try to come with some illustration.   
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:21): have nice time  
arunreddy\_ - (01/06/2009 20:22): :)  
annacondan left at 20:24 ()

Chathurag joined #xwiki at 21:01  
moon-ray left at 21:03 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
Chathurag - (01/06/2009 21:05): marta\_: hai  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:08): is there another way to render an image from the filesystem than using context.getDoc().getAttachmentURL(imageName, myaction, context); ?  
marta\_ - (01/06/2009 21:11): hi Chathurag  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:11): because it requires to add a new action in struts-config.xml  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:12): guillaum1: What do you need?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:12): Render where?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:13): If you want a link to an image, put it in /resources/ and use $xwiki.getSkinFile  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:15): sdumitriu: hi. I generate png image from latex formulae. I use a temp directory as in the chart plugin. Now I gonna use context.getDoc().getAttachmentURL(imageName, myaction, context); to load render it. For that, I need to create a FormulaAction which extends XWikiAction. I'm wondering if there is a simpler way...  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:15): s/ to load render it/to render it  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:16): No, that's the right approach  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:16): sdumitriu: ok thanks  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:16): Too bad you must declare actions in the struts config file  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:16): yeah  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:16): We'll improve this in the future  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:16): cool  
annacondan joined #xwiki at 21:32  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:32): sdumitriu: should I also add an action in the getRight() method from http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/user/impl/xwiki/XWikiRightServiceImpl.java ?  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:32): public String getRight(String action)     {           
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:32): if (actionMap == null) {              
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:32):  actionMap = new HashMap<String, String>();              
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:32):  actionMap.put("login", "login");              
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:33):  actionMap.put("logout", "login");               
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:33): actionMap.put("loginerror", "login");               
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:33): actionMap.put("loginsubmit", "login");   
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:33): ...  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:33): It depends  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:33): By default it's edit  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:33): If you want 'view' or something else, then yes  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:36): sdumitriu: the action only send  the raw image, so I could let "edit" as the action type is not important, isn't it ?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:37): It depends on what users you want to allow to view the image  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:38): "edit" means that only those that could edit the page can view the image  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:38): oops yeah...  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:38): sorry  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 21:39): So I have to recompile one xwiki.jar  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 21:41): Yep, sorry  
moon-ray joined #xwiki at 21:41  
vmassol left at 21:41 ()  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 21:44  
annacondan left at 21:55 ()  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:55  
annacondan joined #xwiki at 22:01  
anamarias left at 22:04 ()  
annacondan left at 22:07 ()  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:10): sdumitriu: I got the plugin working, thanks.   
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:10): Now I have to find a way to get the current default character size from the CSS in order to have an auto-size mode  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 22:11  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:12): From Java?  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:12): yes  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:14): That's a bit too hard to do  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:15): sdumitriu: or I could get the info from the page and pass it to the plugin   
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:15): Plus, even if you get it, in the end the image will have a pixel size, while the text will have a size depending on the DPI  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:16): sdumitriu: so are you saying there is no good solution to do that ?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:16): Yep  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:16): arghhh  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:17): Hm, there might be a solution  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:17): Use SVG  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:18): sdumitriu: Has SVG a different behavior than PNG in current browsers ?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:18): SVG is scalable  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:19): So you can nicely scale it  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:19): But it's too complex  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:19): sure but I'm searching the good scale...  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:19): seems so  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:20): So the user will have to set the size himself...snifff  
lucaa left #xwiki at 22:36  
guillaum1 - (01/06/2009 22:41): sdumitriu: is LGPL mandatory for plugin submission in xwiki trunk ?  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:44): No  
sdumitriu - (01/06/2009 22:45): It is OK, as long as it is provided as a separate download, and not bundled in the default package
